movies.title: I'm Losing My Temper
movies.originalTitle: La moutarde me monte au nez
movies.plot: Pierre Durois is a bumbling school teacher with an eye for the older female students; his father is a reputable surgeon who is running for Mayor. There's a film shooting crew in town and the paparazzi are around too. Zaney antics follow with typical French coincidences to heighten the comic elements.
movies.simplePlot: Pierre Durois is a bumbling school teacher with an eye for the older female students; his father is a reputable surgeon who is running for Mayor. There's a film shooting crew in town and ...

biography.bio: Certainly one of France's supreme farceurs in the classic tradition, comedian Pierre Richard was born to an uppercrust family with an embarrassing riches of middle names as he was christened Pierre Richard Maurice Charles Leopold Defays. Working and building up his trade at the Paris Music Hall in the early years, he appeared in small movie roles thoughout most of the 60s. In the 70s, however, he aimed his genius directly towards film and succeeded beyond the wildest expectations. Directing and co-writing many of his slapstick vehicles, his characters often have taken on an hilariously guileless persona and, coupled with his innate gift for klutzy physical comedy, have become an audience favorite for nearly four decades. His superior work in The Daydreamer (1970) and The Troubles of Alfred (1972) was immediately recognized and this led to the international crossover hit The Tall Blond Man with One Black Shoe (1973) in which Richard played a naive, innocent concert musician plucked by chance to become a superspy on a top secret mission. A potent association in the 1960s and 1970s with actor/producer/director Yves Robert and the 1980s with writer/director Francis Veber and actor Gerard Depardieu produced several comedy classics: Alexander (1967), The Return of the Tall Blond Man with One Black Shoe (1974), The Goat (1981), Les Comperes (1983) and The Fugitives (1986). Many of Richard's classic comedies, including The Toy (1976), have spawned Hollywood remakes and imitations, though most pale compared to the originals.
biography.name: Pierre Richard

biography.bio: Jane Birkin was born on December 14, 1946 in London, England as Jane Mallory Birkin. She is an actress, known for Death on the Nile (1978), Blow-Up (1966) and La belle noiseuse (1991). She was previously married to John Barry.
biography.name: Jane Birkin

biography.bio: Claude Piéplu was born on May 10, 1923 in Paris, France as Claude Léon Auguste Piéplu. He was an actor, known for Asterix and Obelix vs. Caesar (1999), The Discreet Charm of the Bourgeoisie (1972) and The Tenant (1976). He died on May 24, 2006 in Paris.
biography.name: Claude Piéplu

biography.bio: Jean Martin was born on March 6, 1922 in Paris, France. He was an actor, known for The Battle of Algiers (1966), My Name Is Nobody (1973) and The King and the Mockingbird (1980). He died on February 2, 2009 in Paris.
biography.name: Jean Martin

biography.bio: Danielle Minazzoli is an actress, known for I'm Losing My Temper (1974), It's Not Me, It's Him (1980) and The Band (1970).
biography.name: Danielle Minazzoli

biography.bio: Vittorio Caprioli was born on August 15, 1921 in Naples, Campania, Italy. He was an actor and writer, known for General Della Rovere (1959), The Man from Acapulco (1973) and Tout va bien (1972). He was married to Franca Valeri. He died on October 2, 1989 in Naples.
biography.name: Vittorio Caprioli

biography.bio: Passionate about acting, Julien Guiomar has left a lasting imprint on the theater (since 1952), on television (since 1958) and on the big screen (since 1966) in a career spanning five decades. And yet, Guiomar first saw himself as a dentist, ... like Daddy! But he finally proved the saying 'Like father like song' wrong. Too bad for dentistry but so much the better for entertainment which otherwise would have had to do without his singular talent. And, to tell the truth, Julien Guiomar did not coddle himself. He indeed appeared in over thirty plays with Jean Vilar's famed Théâtre National Populaire (TNP); he was in more than forty TV films, in which his incredible presence allowed him to embody such figures as Alexandre Borgia or Diafoirus in Molière's Le malade imaginaire (1971). His film parts are even more numerous and include authority figures (colonels, police commissioners, prelates and even God Himself in Arthur Joffé's curious comedy Let There Be Light (1998). As of his first two appearances, in Philippe de Broca's King of Hearts (1966), as a lunatic who takes himself for a bishop and in Louis Malle's The Thief of Paris (1967) as a phony priest, Julien Guiomar has imposed an image of authority tinged with eccentricity. Always colorful in his expression, he can also exert sheer spitefulness (the colonel in Costa-Gavras Z (1969)) or warm humanity (the surgeon of Serge Korber's Je vous ferai aimer la vie (1979)). He may have been in too many campy comedies but he saves them from total crassness by his mere inspired presence. Julien Guiomar retired in 2004 after a final TV Film.
biography.name: Julien Guiomar

biography.bio: Henri Guybet was born on December 21, 1936 in Paris, France. He is an actor, known for The Mad Adventures of 'Rabbi' Jacob (1973), The Pawn (1978) and On a retrouvé la 7ème Compagnie! (1975).
biography.name: Henri Guybet

biography.bio: Jean-Marie Proslier was born on February 25, 1928 in Montargis, Loiret, France. He was an actor and writer, known for Banzaï (1983), La cravate (1957) and Herbie Goes to Monte Carlo (1977). He died on November 15, 1997 in Evreux, Eure, France.
biography.name: Jean-Marie Proslier

biography.bio: Clément Harari was born on February 10, 1919 in Cairo, Egypt. He was an actor, known for Train of Life (1998), The Fiendish Plot of Dr. Fu Manchu (1980) and Le vol de l'aigle (1982). He died on May 16, 2008 in Sèvres, Hauts-de-Seine, France.
biography.name: Clément Harari

biography.bio: Bruno Balp was born on April 13, 1926 in Roanne, Loire, France. He was an actor, known for A Real Young Girl (1976), The Old Guard (1960) and Let Joy Reign Supreme (1975). He died on May 31, 2008 in Paris, France.
biography.name: Bruno Balp

biography.bio: Isabelle Ceaux is an actress, known for Poil de carotte (1973), I'm Losing My Temper (1974) and Les bidasses au pensionnat (1978).
biography.name: Isabelle Ceaux

biography.bio: Anna Gaylor was born on May 13, 1932 in Paris, France as Anna Senioutovitch. She is an actress, known for Les visiteurs (1993), Life Upside Down (1964) and A Room in Town (1982).
biography.name: Anna Gaylor

biography.bio: Isabelle Gautier is an actress, known for Tendrement vache (1979), I'm Losing My Temper (1974) and Les murs ont des oreilles (1974).
biography.name: Isabelle Gautier

biography.bio: Catherine De Keuchel is an actress, known for I'm Losing My Temper (1974).
biography.name: Catherine De Keuchel

keywords: actor shares first name with character
